## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @luceat-lux-vestra reported an issue on 2025-03-09 where embed buttons weren't working.
* Pieces support bot acknowledged the issue and assigned it to the team.
* The issue was caused by a previously fixed bug related to blacklisting certain pages.
* Enabling embed buttons on the affected page caused the problem.

**Solutions:**

* Disable embed buttons for the specific page via the side panel settings.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of Pieces OS API issue on GitHub **Key points raised:** - Following Pieces OS updates, API port is no longer fixed, leading to automatic port checks. - Checks only target Pieces OS endpoints and do not scan other ports. - User concerned about console flooding due to failing port checks, impacting development workflow. **Problems identified:** - Flooding of dev console with error logs from failed port checks. - Difficulty distinguishing real errors from false positives. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** - Hiding/better handling errors from inactive Pieces OS ports to reduce dev console clutter. (**Pending**) - Extension patch update to address the issue (**released in March 2025 as version 4.0.4**). **Current status/outcome:** - The problem appears to have been resolved with the latest web extension update (version 4.0.4), which should prevent further flooding of the dev console with error messages. **Additional notes:** - Potential Chrome bug might be contributing to the issue, but there's no clear fix at present. - Users can temporarily hide network messages in the dev console to reduce clutter.

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key point:** Copilot responsiveness was significantly slower than expected.

**Problem:** A bug in the copilot's "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" function prevented proper re-initialization of a websocket. This caused the copilot to hang indefinitely while trying to load.

**Solution:**

* **Fix implemented:** The bug was fixed and released in a patch update (Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2).
* **Further performance improvements:** A subsequent update to the Desktop app (version 3.1.0) included further performance enhancements.

**Current status/outcome:**

* **Mixed feedback:** While some users reported improved performance after the updates, others (e.g., JerryBenChizzy, navdeepdev459) continued to experience lag. This suggests the issue might not be fully resolved for everyone.
* **Call for troubleshooting:** Users experiencing lag were encouraged to schedule a chat with the development team for further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue persisted even after hard resets were performed by users.
* The problem appeared to affect various operating systems, including Windows 11.
